FORNEY A NITECKI: FOSSIL MOLLUSCA 23 

Re/erred specimens: two specimens UC 881 1 

Miller and Faber, 1894a, p. 28. pi. I. fig. 21 (UC 88113); fig. 22 (UC 
 881 IB) 
 = Sinuires g/ohutaris (M'lWcr and Faber, 1894) 

Bassler, 1915, p. 1,160 
 = ?Sinuites granistriala (Vlrich in Ulrich and Scofield, 1897) 

Bassler, 1915, p. 1,160 
 Upper Ordovician, Eden. 
 Cincinnati, Ohio. Faber Collection. 

Bellerophon gorbyi Miller, 1891 

Holotype: by monotypy: UC 6138 

Miller, 1891, pp. 84-85, pi. 14, figs. 7-9 

Miller, 1892a, pp. 694-695, pi. 14, figs. 7-9 

Cumings, 1908, pp. 953-954, pi. 39, figs. 1-lb 

Upper Ordovician, Maysville. 

Dearborn County, Indiana. Collected by Prof. S. S. Gorby. Gurley 
 Collection. 

Beilerophon harrodi Gurley, 1883 

Holotype: by monotypy: UC 6319 
 Gurley, 1883, p. 5 

= Pharkidonotus percarinatus (Conrad , 1 842) 
 J. M. Weller, 1929b, pp. 313-315, pi. 1, fig. 6a-6b 

= Beilerophon (Pharkidonotus) percarinatus (Conrad, 1 842) 

Yochelson and Saunders, 1967, p. 49 
 Pennsylvanian, ''UpperCoal Measures." 
 Near Oakwood, Vermillion County, Illinois. Gurley Collection. 

Beilerophon incomptus Gurley, 1884 
 Holotype: not designated, to be selected from UC 6325 

Referred specimens: two specimens UC 6325 
 Gurley, 1884, p. 9 

= Beilerophon crassus var. incomptus Gurley 1884 
 J. M. Weller, 1929b, pp. 317-318, pi. 1, fig. 9a-9b (UC 6325A) 

= Beilerophon (Beilerophon) crassus incomptus Gurley 1884 
 Yochelson and Saunders, 1967, p. 41 

Pennsylvanian, "Coal Measures."
